title: Vintage Serif in Ad Headline
content:
What do you think?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013102902im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/vintageheadline_3738.jpg)

As always, your suggestions are very much appreciated!

 [‹ CARE by Stella Mc Cartney - Dotted Font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013102902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45420 "Go to previous forum topic") [Help Identifying ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013102902/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45452 "Go to next forum topic")
author: malbright

comments.content:
Mike, this one has been keeping me hunting, and I have looked in at least seven books, including McGrew’s book on Metal Type, but I can’t seem to find anything with these traits, even though it has a familiar look. How old is ’vintage’ in this case?

It looks like late 19th century to me, and the lower case resembles DeVinne No. 11 shown in Jaspert, but the M and R don’t fit that at all.

- Mike Yanega

Hi Mike and Lex,  
Wow! Thank you for helping.

This is from a book dating to the mid- to late-1800s.

I’ve been searching a lot too, and have yet to be successful.

Drat! I hate being stumped.

I really appreciate your efforts and maybe the answer is yet to come.

Thank you for helping!
